intro: Browallia eludens, commonly known as the elusive browallia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively uncommon in horticulture.
